setup.question: Why did the physicist and anthropologist travel to Uxen?
answers: Because science was banned on Earth
Because they wanted to study Zen

Text.text: Science is needed for space travel. my reasoning for leaning for B.

The story follows two scientists, Kendrick and Peter, who come to the planet Uxen, which has its own private god, Zen. The story is told from Zen's perspective. They travel to Uxen to study the planet, and, namely, NOT Zen.
. Although science being banned on Earth is not specifically mentioned, the two scientists do note that Earth science was the dream of every Uxena, as if it is somehow limited. Ev in next speech.
Uxen is a planet that with time has fallen behind:
. This is mostly because

and not on Earth, obviously. The physicist and the anthropologist travel to the planet to study Zen, who is the purportedly omnipotent and omniscient God of Uxen. When the prime minister mentions Zen for the first time,
(Kendrick being one of the scientists).
Though they don't say outright to the Uxen people themselves that they are there to study Zen--as that would be controversial--they do admit that they want to conduct
, encompassing Zen.

A. If Earth science was the dream of every Uxena then wouldn't science still be present on Earth and actually banned on Uxen since it is admired?  Social culture involves the culture of the society which seems to be based on what the God of Uxen says. If science is banned on Earth how did these earthlings travel to another planet? I want to see your evidence so I will continue the round.  

B. I believe that science was banned on Uxen and not earth Can you provide a quote that supports Zen is a God? Why is it controversial to study Zen. Why do they want to study Zen? i understand he is a God and that would be interesting but it seems space travel is involved so like is this their first time discovering a God?
